channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Moldova barely approves its EU referendum amid allegations of Russian interference
item.description: Moldova voted in favor of adding a path to the European Union to its constitution, and gave the incumbent president the most votes in elections Sunday, but neither result was the win leaders wanted.
item.content:encoded:
Moldova voted in favor of adding a path to the European Union to its constitution, and gave the incumbent president the most votes in elections Sunday, but neither result was the win leaders wanted.

(Image credit: Pierre Crom)
item.dc:creator: Charles Maynes

item.title: Fake bomb threats disrupt travel for scores of flights on Indian airlines
item.description: Bomb threats are causing disruptions, diversions and delays for scores of flights on multiple Indian airlines. Indian authorities said they were looking to increase punishments for perpetrators.
item.content:encoded:
Bomb threats are causing disruptions, diversions and delays for scores of flights on multiple Indian airlines. Indian authorities said they were looking to increase punishments for perpetrators.

(Image credit: Bruce Bennett)
item.dc:creator: James Doubek

item.title: As the WNBA's historic season comes to an end, players say it's time for higher pay
item.description: Record-breaking TV ratings helped the WNBA secure a more lucrative media rights deal this year. Now, the players' union has opted out of its contract, a move aimed at better salaries and benefits.
item.content:encoded:
Record-breaking TV ratings helped the WNBA secure a more lucrative media rights deal this year. Now, the players' union has opted out of its contract, a move aimed at better salaries and benefits.

(Image credit: Steph Chambers)
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: Russia Versus the West in Moldova's Election
item.description:
The former Soviet republic of Moldova narrowly passed a referendum to pursue membership in the European Union. That puts it at odds with Russia, which is accused of meddling in the election. Our correspondent in Moscow tells us what the vote could mean.

And we go to the bar in Paris that for over a century has held a U.S. presidential straw poll that is usually accurate.
item.content:encoded:
The former Soviet republic of Moldova narrowly passed a referendum to pursue membership in the European Union. That puts it at odds with Russia, which is accused of meddling in the election. Our correspondent in Moscow tells us what the vote could mean.

And we go to the bar in Paris that for over a century has held a U.S. presidential straw poll that is usually accurate.
item.dc:creator: Charles Maynes

item.title: Republican lawsuits over overseas and military voting hit setbacks in 2 swing states
item.description: In Michigan and North Carolina, two Republican legal challenges to the legitimacy of ballots cast by U.S. citizens living abroad, including U.S. military members, hit setbacks Monday.
item.content:encoded:
In Michigan and North Carolina, two Republican legal challenges to the legitimacy of ballots cast by U.S. citizens living abroad, including U.S. military members, hit setbacks Monday.

(Image credit: Allison Joyce)
item.dc:creator: Hansi Lo Wang

item.title: GOP candidate for NC schools chief has spread falsehoods, ‘groomer’ rhetoric
item.description: Michele Morrow has a track record of falsehoods - for example, saying Islam is a cult and that the plus in LGTBTQ+ stands for pedophilia.
item.content:encoded:
Michele Morrow has a track record of falsehoods - for example, saying Islam is a cult and that the plus in LGTBTQ+ stands for pedophilia.

(Image credit: Liz Schlemmer)
item.dc:creator: Liz Schlemmer

item.title: Local voter guides: Find candidate information and resources in your community
item.description: What you need to know about the races, issues and decisions being made in your community.
item.content:encoded:
What you need to know about the races, issues and decisions being made in your community.

(Image credit: Timothy A. Clary)
item.dc:creator: The NPR Network

item.title: A frustrated Supreme Court to look at one version of judge shopping
item.description: Both liberal and conservative lawyers have judge-shopped, but in recent years, some conservative-leaning groups have been laser focused on bringing their challenges in the Fifth Circuit Court of Appeals.
item.content:encoded:
Both liberal and conservative lawyers have judge-shopped, but in recent years, some conservative-leaning groups have been laser focused on bringing their challenges in the Fifth Circuit Court of Appeals.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Nina Totenberg

item.title: 4 people are dead after a helicopter crash in Houston
item.description: Houston officials say the helicopter was flying from Ellington Airport when it crashed into a radio tower.
item.content:encoded:
Houston officials say the helicopter was flying from Ellington Airport when it crashed into a radio tower.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: Supreme Court declines challenge to CPSC's structure, for now
item.description: The court left in place a 90-year old landmark decision that declared that presidents cannot fire members of a multi-member independent agency, except in cases of bad behavior.
item.content:encoded:
The court left in place a 90-year old landmark decision that declared that presidents cannot fire members of a multi-member independent agency, except in cases of bad behavior.

(Image credit: Tom Brenner)
item.dc:creator: Nina Totenberg
